accussed_details.name: Muhammad Juman
allegation: Fraudulent transfer of land to wife to appear landless

complaint_summary: Petitioner Sulleman Sanwal challenged the grant of disputed land to respondent Muhammad Juman, alleging favoritism, misrepresentation, and violation of land grant policy.
investigation_summary: The court reviewed records showing respondent exceeded the land ceiling limit, transferred land to his wife to appear landless, and misrepresented his residence to qualify for the grant. Identity card records further supported the misrepresentation claim.
judgment_summary: The court revoked the grant of disputed land to respondent Muhammad Juman and awarded it to petitioner Sulleman Sanwal, citing violations of land grant policy, fraudulent actions, and exceeding the land ceiling limit.
punishment: Revocation of land grant to respondent; land awarded to petitioner.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition accepted; grant of disputed land revoked from respondent and awarded to petitioner.
legal_arguments: Violation of land ceiling limit under Land Grant Policy
Fraudulent transfer of land to wife to appear landless
Misrepresentation of residence to qualify for grant

witness_statement.Munshi Fakir Muhammad: Reported petitioner as a bona fide resident of Deh Keti and adjacent Deh Soomra.

key_issues: Eligibility for land grant under Land Grant Policy

key_findings.petitioner_residence: Deh Keti or adjacent Deh Soomra
key_findings.respondent_gift_transaction: Gifted 6-36 Acres to wife Mst. Allah Bachai
key_findings.identity_card_issue: Identity Card CA 123343 showing residence as Goth and Deh Keti

judgment_order.revocation: Grant of disputed land to respondent revoked
judgment_order.new_grant: Disputed land granted to petitioner Sulleman Sanwal

legal_terms.Hari: Tenant farmer or landless agricultural worker.

words_and_phrases.Land Grant Policy: Policy governing allocation of land based on eligibility criteria.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner successfully challenged respondent's eligibility for land grant based on fraudulent actions, exceeding land ceiling limits, and policy violations. Court revoked grant and awarded land to petitioner.
